titleInfo.title: John B. Brownlow in Washington, D.C. to O.P. Temple

subject.geographic: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).

subject.topic: Floyd, John B.; Grant, Ulysses S.; President Grant; Johnson, Andrew; King Kalakaua; Knoxville Daily Chronicle; New York Tribune; Republican; Sugar Treaty; Taylor, Bob; Weekly Whig.

mods.note: Andrew Johnson "sworn in" as Senator at called session March 4, 1875; Johnson`s last speech denouncing Grant and Brownlow; Brownlow`s reply to Johnson; Brownlow and Grant; and Bob Taylor`s lecture in Washington.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
